comments: A prime p is regular if and only if the numerators of the Bernoulli numbers B_2, B_4, ..., B_{p-3} (A000367) are not divisible by p.
references: Z. I. Borevich and I. R. Shafarevich, Number Theory. Academic Press, NY, 1966, pp. 425-430.
H. M. Edwards, Fermat's Last Theorem, Springer, 1977.
